x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.potential_impact: Automating surplus food matching could redirect thousands of meals weekly to those in need, reduce landfill waste, and support community food banks efficiently. It could also help businesses meet sustainability goals and report social impact metrics automatically.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: In the UK, thousands of tons of edible food are wasted daily by supermarkets, restaurants, and caterers while many families struggle with food insecurity. The donation and redistribution process is still mostly manual requiring calls, emails, or spreadsheets causing delays and waste.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: Food Rescue UK – Automated Surplus Food Redistribution
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

Use ServiceNow Flow Designer and Integration Hub to automate donation requests from supermarkets and restaurants. Now Platform dashboards would track donations in real time, and Field Service Management could coordinate pickup logistics with local charities and drivers.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

Integration with Google Maps API for location tracking, retailer POS systems or inventory APIs, and optional WhatsApp/SMS notifications for charities.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Ensuring real-time inventory data accuracy, managing food safety and expiry tracking, and engaging smaller food outlets with limited tech resources.
